From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

Lunarpine pressed on through the snow and ice, he found a fresh trail of
blood on the ground. He picked up Ice's scent and continued forward. He came
upon what appeared to be a frozen river. he could see a hole in it. He
feared the worst, if she fell in it could spread the virus even faster. He
contacted Veratis hoping the old bot would put his fears to rest.

"No sign of the virus in the water." Veratis said with a sigh of relief.
He'd lost her on his scanners but could still give Lunarpine a direction to
head in in order to find her and bring her back.He hoped she was only a
carrier and not a victim. Veratis knew that Lunarpines body was immune to
the virus, unless it had mutated inside Ice.

Lunarpine was relieved at the close call, he again transformed, this time
into his half wolf stage and began moving. He'd lost a little speed but
gained strength which caused him to move a little faster, he could force his
way through the snow more easily than run through. He howled to the sky
hoping Ice would get the message and come home. He missed Shadow Wing. He
didn't get to know Ice, and now he might never get the chance. He might have
shed a tear if the freezing winds hadn't frozen his ducts. This was like he
remembered his crash site was like in northern canada. A frozen wonderland
where he'd met her, now it was his turn to search for her, He was glad, he
never thought he'd have the chance again.
----- Original Message -----
From: <logomorph@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, November 12, 2000 7:05 PM
Subject: Ice


> ::Ice:;
>
> She stopped at the end of the ice field. She collapsed on her side.
> She fell into a drift of snow and layed there, on her side. She was
> breathing heavy and could see her breath in the cold air.  Her
> shoulder was hurtingher too much to continue on. Her shoulder was
> just pouring out the red liquid. She could barely move at all.
>
> She heard a muffled voice on her commlink. But she couldn't make it
> out.
>
>
>
>
>
